Immediate Stop to North-Targeted War Exercises Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek, south Korea, reportedly issued a statement on Mar. 26. The statement condemned the aggressive joint military exercises aimed at deterring the inter-Korean relations from improving and threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula and strongly urged the United States and the south Korean authorities to immediately stop them.
 The U.S. claims these war maneuvers are "annual drills for a defensive purpose" but they are war maneuvers for invading the north launched according to its strategy of a preemptive nuclear attack on the north from every angle as they involve huge armed forces including at least 20,000 U.S. troops and nuclear-powered carrier "Abraham Lincoln", the statement noted.    
 It condemned the U.S. for busying itself to expand its military base in Phyongthaek in a bid to secure a military stronghold for preempting an attack on the north according to the agreement reached on the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. troops and the scenarios for a war against the north and the south Korean authorities for yielding to its pressure.

Book and Collection of Poems on DPRK Published in Russia 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on March 24 brought out book "The DPRK-Invincible Bulwark of Socialism" authored by Vladimir Yakushev, deputy editor of the paper "Rosiskaya Pravda", and a collection of poems "March of Songun Victory" written by Russian poet Alexandr Brezhnev on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.

16th Individual Contest for "February 16 Art Prize" Closed 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The 16th individual contest for "February 16 Art Prize" was closed.
 The first place was taken by Choe Hye Ran, player of the State National Art Troupe, and Kim Son Yong, player of the North Phyongan Provincial Art Troupe.
 At a closing ceremony held on March 29, 46 winners were awarded certificates and medals.    
 Present there were Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song, officials concerned, artistes of capital and local art troupes and teachers and students of art educational institutions.

articles.content:
Symposium on Juche-Based Aesthetic Idea Held
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A symposium in the field of movie industry on leader Kim Jong Il's Juche-oriented aesthetic idea was held on Mar. 29.
 The symposium discussed tasks to be tackled to bring about a fresh turn in movie-making true to his Juche-oriented aesthetic idea and ways to do so.
 Recalling that Kim Jong Il clearly indicated the way for the Juche-oriented cinematic art to follow, speakers pointed out that he has always paid deep attention to the creation of films and shown great loving care for those actors and actresses who distinguished themselves in truthful acting, thereby leading the creators and artistes with profound care to produce hits.    
 They underscored the need for the moviemen to thoroughly implement the Workers' Party of Korea's Juche-oriented idea and theory of literature and art so that the cinematic art may make a positive contribution to stepping up the on-going general march of Songun revolution to build a great prosperous powerful nation.
 They also called on all creators and artistes to devote their wisdom and energies to producing movies loved by the servicepersons and people, bearing deep in mind the importance of the cinematic art in developing the overall literature and art.
 The symposium was attended by Kim Jong Ho, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and the Arts of Korea, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of movie industry, officials guiding creative institutions and teachers and students.
